WorkItem.ClosedComment: Duplicate of 7966.  This issue will be fixed in the next release of WPF Toolkit.
WorkItem.Description:
There's neither property is set  after selecting a date in the DatePicker.
 
I've run the WPFFeaturesPreviewHOLOnline Checkbookmanager, and there also, you can edit a date but it doesn't change after editing (when you leave the column the old date is displayed)...
 
All the other columns do change however?
 
I'm running this in Belgium as it might be  a localization problem.
 
It seems pretty bizar that these properties should not work. That would mean nobody has been able to use the control...
 
Regards,
 
Dave
WorkItem.Summary: DatePicker SelectedDate and Text Property don't bind or don't return value...

Comments.Message:
we have a fix for this issue and it will be in the future release of WPF Toolkit. 
For now you will have to use two way binding mode when binding to the property.
